required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of Non-invasive Assessment, Using C.A 2.0 Device, Versus Invasive Assessment of LVEDP
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation of Non-invasive Assessment, Using C.A 2.0 Device, Versus Invasive Assessment of Left Ventricular End Diastolic Pressure (LVEDP)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine the accuracy of non-invasive assessment of LVEDP using the investigational device C.A 2.0.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Establish the accuracy of the non-invasive device, C.A 2.0, to estimate LVEDP comparing it to the invasive hemodynamic measurement via left heart catheterization

study_pop.textblock: Subjects undergoing elective cardiac catheterization, during which LVED and aortic pressures are recorded

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male subject between the ages of 18 - 80 years or postmenopausal female up to 80 years of age
2. Patient undergoing elective cardiac catheterization during which LVED and aortic pressures are recorded
3. Willing and able to sign informed consent prior to study initiation
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has a baseline heart rate of < 60 or >100 beats/min
2. Subject has moderate to severe valvular disease
3. Subject suffers from atrial fibrillation or other tachyarrhythmias
4. Subject suffers from hemodynamic instability
5. Subject is candidate for primary PCI
